title: Rubble plugin generates shapes with physically unrealistic inertia

content.raw:
I exported a world sdf from vrc_task2 as an example:
~~~
    <model name='rubble_0'>
      <pose>4.012130 10.400500 0.203200 0.341832 -0.015198 1.924930</pose>
      <link name='link'>
        <inertial>
          <mass>0.869906</mass>
          <inertia>
            <ixx>0.014966</ixx>
            <iyy>0.005986</iyy>
            <izz>0.014966</izz>
            <ixy>0.000000</ixy>
            <ixz>0.000000</ixz>
            <iyz>0.000000</iyz>
          </inertia>
        </inertial>
        <collision name='collision'>
          <geometry>
            <box>
              <size>0.203200 0.203200 0.406400</size>
            </box>
          </geometry>
        </collision>
      </link>
    </model>
~~~
For rubble_0, the x and y box dimensions are equal, but the ixx and izz inertias are equal.
~~~
rubble_0
size:          0.203200 0.203200 0.406400
ixx iyy izz:   0.014966 0.005986 0.014966
~~~
content.html:
I exported a world sdf from vrc_task2 as an example:

    <model name='rubble_0'>
      <pose>4.012130 10.400500 0.203200 0.341832 -0.015198 1.924930</pose>
      <link name='link'>
        <inertial>
          <mass>0.869906</mass>
          <inertia>
            <ixx>0.014966</ixx>
            <iyy>0.005986</iyy>
            <izz>0.014966</izz>
            <ixy>0.000000</ixy>
            <ixz>0.000000</ixz>
            <iyz>0.000000</iyz>
          </inertia>
        </inertial>
        <collision name='collision'>
          <geometry>
            <box>
              <size>0.203200 0.203200 0.406400</size>
            </box>
          </geometry>
        </collision>
      </link>
    </model>

For rubble_0, the x and y box dimensions are equal, but the ixx and izz inertias are equal.

rubble_0
size:          0.203200 0.203200 0.406400
ixx iyy izz:   0.014966 0.005986 0.014966
